intro: Ctenium aromaticum, commonly known as sweet ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ctenium aromaticum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates.
